lead_paragraph: Greg Maddux won his 16th Gold Glove yesterday, tying the record shared by pitcher Jim Kaat and third baseman Brooks Robinson. He has been the National League’s Gold Glove pitcher in all but one year since 1990. Atlanta’s Mike Hampton won it in 2003. San Francisco shortstop Omar Vizquel won his 11th Gold Glove. He is two shy of the record for shortstops, held by Ozzie Smith. The other winners were outfielders Andruw Jones, Carlos Beltrán and Mike Cameron, third baseman Scott Rolen, first baseman Albert Pujols, catcher Brad Ausmus and second baseman Orlando Hudson.
